title: Technical Support fluent in English and Polish
System Integration Specialist
description:
|  THE EXPERIENCE MATTERS  
  
C3i Healthcare Connections, a division of Telerx, is an American, company,
leading provider of technical support services for life sciences companies
worldwide. We operate in the field of Information technologies (IT) and their
application for the needs of the Pharmaceutical industry and clinical research
organizations. Since we had opened the office in Sofia, Bulgaria in 2005, we
managed to attract many talented and motivated people and helped them develop
their potential.  
  
To ensure the expansion of our Operations Center in Sofia, Bulgaria we are now
looking to recruit a System Integration Specialist.  
  
The SYSTEM INTEGRATION SPECIALIST will provide technical and investigational
support to customers experiencing issues with systems integrated in landscape
environment. The role will partner with Business Counterparts to facilitate
issue resolution, and utilize all technical resources available while adhering
to strict quality standards and regulatory requirements.  
  
Main responsibilities:  
• Provide professional and timely support to customers with reported various
technical issues  
• Identify root causes of the reported issues through analysis of log files,
database tables and server activities;  
• Identify miscommunication between systems in the landscape and supportive
modules of Integrated Drug Supply systems;  
• Act as a first escalation point to C3i Tier I Helpdesk, Supply Super Users
and Admin Applications teams for incidents in scope, identify and examine
trends in escalated cases and incidents;  
• Escalate and regularly monitor advanced customer issues to the respective
Third party escalation teams;  
• Prepare ad-hoc and regular reporting upon Client request or upon Helpdesk
Management request;  
• Identify and recommend opportunities to improve and enhance technical
processes;  
• Participate in special projects, client events and visits, as outlined by
management.  
  
Job requirements:  
• Fluency in English  
• Preferred university education, or at least 3rd year student, in the field
of Information technology, Informatics, Computer systems and technologies or
relevant certification  
• Experience in user support, application support, application development or
related areas  
• Knowledge of:  
\- security access concept, security systems, cryptographic certificates and
software frameworks such as but not limited to: PKI, TLS, HTTPS, WAF  
\- XML markup language.  
\- SQLPLUS utility and/or Oracle Queue middleware will be considered a strong
advantage  
• Experience supporting applications and/or Knowledge of clinical trial
systems and data collection methods will be a plus  
• Excellent communication and problem solving skills  
• Availability to work on shifts  
  
What we offer:  
• Professional on-boarding and on-going trainings  
• Opportunity to practice your foreign language skills and develop your
technical expertise  
• Opportunity for career progression with a leading US Company  
• Competitive salary and performance bonuses  
• Social benefits package  
• Possibility to combine work and study  
• Vibrant environment  
  
Are you willing to build up your career with us? - We’ll be happy to receive
your resume in English!  
  
*Your personal data is secure with us.  
** Only candidates selected for interview will be contacted

title: QA Engineer
description:
|  Playtech is a leading software provider for online gaming operators and can
be positively considered as one of the pioneers of the worldwide online and
land-based gaming industry. Company's business portfolio consists of the most
prominent names in the business, including Bet365, William Hill, Paddypower,
Gala, Coral, Betclic, Winner, Betfair, Poker770, etc. Behind the eminent
success of Playtech's products and services there are around 5,000 people
located in 13 countries, the majority of whom are engaged in research and
development of current and future gaming technologies.  
  
If you are creative, “out of box thinker”, youthful in your mind and ambitious
enough to make a difference in such a large scale international business, you
are more than welcome to apply for one of our open positions.  
  
  
  
  
** Job Description:**  

  * Taking part in QA processes, reading and analysis of requirements, implementation of test plans, testing of a new product
  * Ensuring the overall quality of the product; functional and non-functional testing
  * Data collection and working closely with developers and designers
  * Automation of test cases using Sikuli

  
  
** Requirements:**

  * Good knowledge of software Testing methodologies and procedures
  * Good knowledge of development standards and testing tools
  * Basic understanding of OOP principles, DB theory, algorithms
  * Experience in testing methodologies and tools 
  * Good command of English language (spoken and written)

  
  
** We Offer:**   

  * Friendly environment in a team of highly skilled and motivated young people
  * Personal and professional development and unlimited growth opportunities
  * Work on interesting projects in a leading multinational company
  * Excellent remuneration and benefits package (additional medical insurance, food vouchers, free snacks and beverages, bonuses, etc.)
  * Flexible working time and fresh atmosphere 
  * Trainings and regular team-buildings 

  
  
Please, send your CV in English!

title: Software Support Specialist with Arabic and English
description:
|  We are a global IT service provider supplying technical services to top
500+ companies around the world. With clients across the world we’re proud to
be highly recognized for our commitment to providing exceptional technical
expertise and customer care. There are 1200+ professionals working in
different IT areas at Tek Expert. We have centers in Malta, Costa Rica, China,
Vietnam, and Bulgaria.  
For our main office in Europe, located in Sofia we have the pleasure to invite
you to join our team as a:  
  
Software Support Specialist with Arabic and English  
  
Your role:  
  
The primary responsibility of the Support Engineer is to manage reactive
customer cases to a satisfactory resolution. The engineer has the full
responsibility of technical support to our customers. She/he will perform
suitable information gathering, troubleshooting and problem research,
collaborating with other engineers as necessary.  
  
Our requirements:  
  
• Fluency in Arabic and English  
• Experience with Linux, Windows, Windows server, Databases  
• Troubleshooting and problem solving skills  
• Proficiency with MS Office  
• IT Industry experience  
• Customer Support and/or Account Management experience  
• Degree in a technical/ scientific discipline would be an advantage  
  
*Please note, knowledge of both languages Arabic and English is required.  
  
We offer:  
  
Professional and personal growth through learning and development
opportunities  
Fast-track career in a continuously growing company with strong promote- from-
within culture  
Dynamic, friendly, energetic and fast-pace environment  
Great team of talented colleagues and responsive managers willing to support,
guide, and coach you  
  
If you are motivated for this opportunity and you believe you have the skills
and knowledge required for this role, please send us your resume in English.
All documents will be treated in the strictest confidentiality.  
  
Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

title: Quality Assurance Software Engineer
description:
|  Opencode Systems is a telecommunications solution provider, dedicated to
open systems for All-G and Telco-over-Cloud mobile networks. Our specialized
core network technology is invisible to consumers but underlies many of the
mobile services they use.  
Opencode real-time core network products include Multi-Channel Network Browser
& Studio, iSDP (IMS Service Delivery Platform), Network Services Broker,
Core Messaging Suite, Carrier App Browser and other first-to-market
specialized solutions. Over 60 active mobile operators in more than 40
countries worldwide rely 24/7 on Opencode core network platforms. Opencode
patented, game-changing, network- and cloud-driven virtualized technology is
the preferred choice for the open and creative mobile network.  
  
Due to expanding its activities the company is looking for an experienced
Quality Assurance Software Engineer  
  
Main Responsibilities:  
• Analysis of the customer requirements and identification of potential gaps  
• Preparation and execution of test books and test cases  
• Testing services for correctness based on the specifications agreed with the
client  
• Checking compliance of the service documentation  
• Analysis of clients' reported software bugs and identifying the root cause
of the reported issues  
• Develop and implement moderately complex test plans and test cases  
• Participate in special or customer-specific projects as assigned and
implement Quality Assurance efforts  
• Propose improvements  
• Report to QA team leader  
• Report to Country Manager  
• Work closely with the customer for identifying and resolving service gaps  
  
Requirements:  
• Education in Computer Science and Informatics or related  
• Good knowledge in Quality Assurance and Control  
• Understanding of DB theory, algorithms, etc.  
• Good knowledge of English (spoken and written)  
• Knowledge in programming language  
• Experience in Linux/Unix environment  
• Knowledge of basic shell scripting  
  
  
Advantages:  
• Ability to be productive and handle multiple tasks to meet deadlines in a
dynamic environment  
• Software testing technology  
• Experience in telecommunication field  
• Experience in PHP/JS/other scripting language  
  
Company offers:  
• Challenging and dynamic international work environment  
• Opportunities for career growth  
• Company training  
• Competitive remuneration package  
• Young united team, consisting of very good specialists  
  
Do you want to work with multinational mobile operators & leading industry
experts?  
Please send your CV (in English).

title: Системен администратор
description:
|  Максима България ЕООД е представител на литовската компания Maxima Grupe
UAB – най-големия инвеститор в Литва, Латвия и Естония. В нейните структури
работят над 25 000 служители. Компанията оперира на българския пазар, като
собственик на веригата магазини Т-Маркет и Т-Маркет Експрес, с 61 супермаркета
в цялата стрaна.  
  
Във връзка с разрастване на дейността, търсим:  
  
СИСТЕМЕН АДМИНИСТРАТОР в офис София  
  
ОТГОВОРНОСТИ:  
\- Инсталиране, конфигуриране и мониторинг на мрежовото оборудване и сървърни
системи.  
\- Консултиране и поддържане на външно интегрирани финансови системи.  
\- Осъщестявяване на системен анализ и инсталиране на критични и security
patches и update на Windows сървъри и приложения на работните станции.  
\- Конфигуриране и поддръжка на helpdesk системи и системи за наблюдение на
мрежовата производителност и свързаност.  
\- Управление на потребителите и правата на достъп до информационните системи.  
\- Техническа поддръжка на различните потребители на Максима България.  
  
ИЗИСКВАНИЯ:  
\- Висше образование – Компютърни системи и технологии, Информационни
технологии, Информатика или друго подходящо за длъжността.  
\- Опит – не по-малко от 2 години. Опит придобит в търговски или логистични
компании ще се приеме за предимство.  
\- Отлично познаване на Windows операционни системи, умения за интеграция и
експлоатация на сървърни и комуникационни системи.  
\- Добро познаване на Linux операционни системи.  
\- Отговорност и прецизност при отстраняване на възникнали проблеми.  
\- Умения за работа в екип.  
\- Добри познания по английски език.  
\- Шофьорска книжка.  
  
ПРЕДЛАГАМЕ:  
\- Конкурентно възнаграждение;  
\- Индивидуално кариерно развитие;  
\- Участие в иновативни софтуерни проекти;  
\- Участие в различни програми за обучение и тренинг програми;  
\- Осигурен транспорт до работното място.  
  
Ако предложението представлява интерес за Вас, моля кандидатствайте по тази
обява, като изпратите своята професионална автобиография.

title: Senior Delivery Manager
description:
|  **Every day, people create amazing solutions at EPAM. Imagine, what you
could do!**  
  
Striving for excellence is in our DNA. Since 1993, we have been helping the
world’s leading companies imagine, design, engineer, and deliver software and
digital experiences that change the world. We are more than just specialists,
we are experts.  

Currently we are looking for a **Senior Delivery Manager **for our office to
make the team even stronger.

  
**Responsibilities:**  

  * Co-ordinate the preparation of customer proposals and statements of work
  * Participates in new business development
  * Deliver customer projects successfully
  * Manage customer expectations and relationship
  * Ensure that projects are delivered in line with EPAM process and methodologies
  * Address customer issues during an engagement in cooperation with the Account Manager
  * Make sure that the customer executes their responsibilities on the engagements
  * Identify and manage engagement risks and flag major issues early
  * Participate in overall project management, time estimation, and resource scheduling
  * Prepare engagement revenue and resource forecasts
  * Prepare engagement timesheets and billing information
  * Preparation of the weekly/monthly engagement reports
  * Prepare estimations on time frames, quality and quantity of resources required to successfully implement projects; develops project plan incorporating all project variables
  * Establish criteria concerning deliverability, performance, maintenance, design and costs
  * Assist in analyzing client processes through needs analysis and recommending new business models, workflows, or innovative solutions
  * Contribute to and manage engagement and process improvements
  * Suggest innovative solutions to business problems/processes that leverage technology to provide marketing differentiation, efficiency improvements, and better user experiences
  * Occasional mentoring of peers, including making sure that the offshore and onsite project team undertakes their duties effectively
  * Travel to client sites as needed
  * 

**Required skills and experience:**

  * **5-10 years’ experience working in consulting or outsourcing account/delivery management;**
  * Strong understanding of software development;
  * **5+ years' project management experience;**
  * Ability to establish solid working relationships with clients, plus the ability to work effectively as a virtual member of a dynamic, dispersed team and to meet deadlines;
  * Strong experience working with distributed teams on client side;
  * Excellent communication, presentation, and planning skills are necessary;
  * Expected to have exceptional organization, leadership and stakeholder management skills;
  * Self-motivated, multitasking, reliable to deliver on time, a quick-thinker, be able to work in a fast-paced work environment.
  * **Strong development experience with Java/C# or other software platform **
  * Knowledge in DevOps processes is advantage.
  * **Agile experience and/or knowledge **

  
**EPAM offers:**

  * Attractive salary, additional **health and dental insurance** as long as other **social benefits;**
  * **Personal development** program that will allow people to be valued for their**strengths;**
  * Wide range of **professional trainings** and workshops;
  * **Broad projects** variety and** possible mobility** between projects over the time;
  * **Experience exchange** with colleagues around the world;
  * **Work-life balance** and flexible schedule, team buildings and sport opportunities;
  * Modern office in the **Infinity Tower** business center. 

  

**About us:**

EPAM Systems is an **US based** software services and solutions provider
ranked **#1 in Central and Eastern Europe** with over 15 000 employees. From
software products to core business applications, EPAM has provided expert
consulting, development, testing, support and infrastructure services to many
of the world’s leading organizations. As the world of technology has evolved,
so has our distributed delivery model, which now includes advanced
capabilities in running **Agile and Lean engagements. **Recognized as a Leader
in Product Development in CEE - we have just opened our **office in Sofia**
and you have a unique chance to be a member of our Bulgarian team from the
very beginning. Join us now!

_  
If you are interested in this role please send your CV in English._

_All applications will be treated as strictly confidential._

_Only short-listed applicants will be contacted._

title: QA ENGINEER
description:
|

**DESCRIPTION  
**  
We are an international software company focused on mobile security, privacy
and end-to-end encryption. Our flagship products are the Android-based Secure
Phone and Secure Pack, as well as Secure BlackBerry.  
  
**Secure Group**, formerly DELATEK, is an international provider of solutions for secure mobile communications. As the name implies, we enable our customers to exchange sensitive information safely, protecting their business and personal life.  
  
We have built a name for our secure and user-friendly Secure Phone and Secure
BlackBerry smartphones, as well as Secure Pack — our suite of mobile
communication apps. Our products employ the best end-to-end encryption
technologies available.  
  
**OUR MISSION**  
  
Our ultimate mission is to ensure our customers’ cybersecurity and enable them
to communicate in full privacy without compromising neither protection, nor
user-friendliness.  
  
**OUR VISION**  
  
No great goal could ever be achieved without a great vision. To accomplish our
mission, we have committed to providing the best encrypted communication
products, services and solutions, and to educating people.  
  
**We're now hiring a QA Engineer at our main R&D center, located in Sofia, Bulgaria.**

**REQUIREMENTS**  

  * Relevant education
  * 2+ years of experience in software quality assurance
  * Experience with version control systems
  * Knowledge in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  * Working level of English

_**It would be advantageous** if you have some knowledge or experience with:_  

  * Agile methodologies
  * At least some of the following: CasperJS, NodeJS, MySQL, Apache, Tableau, web analytics tools
  * Software test automation tools
  * Tools like Selenium, Jira, GIT, SoapUI

**BENEFITS  
**

  * Competitive** remuneration**
  * Excellent working** environment**
  * Spacious office with** entertainment** and** relaxation** areas
  * We'll invest in your education — company-paid** tech courses**
  * Extra** day off** for each year you work at the company
  * Company-sponsored **SportPass** cards for various sports activities
  * Private **health insurance**
  * Free** parking**
  * **Relocation** assistance
  * And more...

_If you think we might be a good match, send us your **CV in English** now!_

title: Survey scripter
description:
|  MAP MR is a well known name in the international markets for outsourced
online research and partner of four out of the top seven global market
research agencies. Due to expansion of our service bureau, we are seeking to
appoint ambitious committed candidates with knowledge of basic programming
principles in the role of Survey Programmer.  
  
Responsibilities include: Project management, Survey design and scripting,
Quality Control  
  
Requirements:  
Good knowledge and experience in JavaScript/ jQuery; Fluent command of
English; Excellent communication and organizational skills, Ability to work
under pressure with strict deadlines.  
  
Company offers:  
Work in well-established and dynamic international environment, Excellent
opportunity for professional growth, Extensive professional education and
training, Attractive remuneration package.  
  
Work time:  
Flexible, on shifts. Open positions- day and night shifts. The company covers
the travel expenses.  
  
To become a part of our team, please send your CV online. Shortlisted
candidates will be invited to interview.

company: Hewlett Packard Enterprise / Hewlett-Packard GDBC EOOD
title: UNIX Capacity Specialist
description:
|  
Hewlett Packard Enterprise is an industry leading technology company that
enables customers to go further, faster. With the industry’s most
comprehensive portfolio, spanning the cloud to the data center to workplace
applications, our technology and services help customers around the world make
IT more efficient, more productive and more secure.  
  
The Capacity Specialist is responsible for applying detailed technical
capacity planning knowledge to the process. The Planner collates information
for all new or changed infrastructure, defines and requests expansion
requirements, estimates overall growth or reduction of user demand and
anticipates the effect of improvements in technology on overall component
demand. The candidate should possess a solid understanding of their technology
and be capable of making sound, informed judgements in a timely and accurate
manner. The Capacity Specialist would be working in a global environment
providing technical inputs that inform the optimum spend of an annual budget
in excess of $10m.  
  
The Capacity Planner is responsible for applying detailed technical Capacity
Planning knowledge to the process. This is a dynamic position, supporting the
Capacity Management team in a highly visible positon. This position will
functionally report to the Global Client Capability lead. The Planner
accumulates information for all new or changed infrastructures and defines
expansion requirements. Estimating overall growth or decrease of user demand
and anticipated improvements in technology on overall component demand is a
key responsibility for this role.  
  
  
Job specifics/responsibilities:  
  
  
• Produce capacity plans in line with business planning cycles; identifying
requirements early enough to accommodate procurement and approval lead times.  
• Document need for increases and reductions in hardware based on service
level requirements, targets and cost constraints.  
• Provide regular management reports which include current usage of resources,
trends and forecasts  
• Provide holistic management of capacity that includes people and processes
as well as technology  
• Oversee decisions and actions to utilize Demand Management for controlling
capacity when necessary  
• Ensure shortfalls in capacity are recognized and appropriate corrective
actions are identified and progressed on a timely basis  
• Create and maintain forward looking capacity forecasts to predict future
hardware/software spend  
• Provide regular reports on capacity to direct line management  
• Organize and maintain a regular capacity review process  
• Agree appropriate actions to maintain or improve capacity levels  
• Initiate and coordinate actions required to maintain or improve capacity
across appropriate IT units  
• Act as a coordination point for changes to capacity levels when needed  
  
  
  
Qualifications  
  
  
• Technical background (5+ years of experience desired) in Linux/ UNIX,
specifically Redhat 6.5, Solaris 2.9/8/9/10, SLES 8/9/10/11, AIX 5.x, 6.1, OEL
5.8 as well as Veritas RHEL, Veritas 4.x Solaris / AIX, Veritas 5.0 Solaris /
AIX, Veritas 5.1 Solaris / AIX  
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related
field or equivalent work experience.  
• Proven track record managing resources and business requirements.  
• Good arithmetic skills and experience or dealing with budgets, statistics
and forecasting models.  
• Fluent in written and verbal English  
  
This role provides the opportunity to learn about ITIL and capacity management
in detail and to grow from purely technical professional to a broader role
with global scope.  
  
We offer:  
  
• Great opportunity for professional development in the IT field  
• Extensive training program  
• Environment that stimulates achievements and excellent customer service  
• Part in a team that has established itself as a preferred partner for Hi-
tech Services & Support throughout EMEA  
• Competitive remuneration package  
• Medical insurance.  
• 4 days additional paid leave (total:24 days).  
• Food vouchers.  
• Opportunity to use free parking slots.  
• Life insurance.  
• Wellness program including company funded sport events and seminars.  
• HPE badge program including various discounts for products and services.  
• Work-life balance program including free legal, financial and psychological
consultations  
  
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  
  
This is to inform you that Hewlett Packard Enterprise GDBC EOOD (HPE) is
registered as an administrator of personal data to the Commission for Data
Protection. Some of the information that you provide voluntarily is personal
information and falls under the special protection regime under the Law on
Personal Data Protection. The personal data provided by you will be processed
for the purposes of the selection process as well as for the realization of
the legitimate interests of the data controller in respect of any future
contract of employment. HPE takes the responsibility to handle, use and store
your personal data, ensuring its protection in secret from the third parties.
We inform you and you agree that HPE may provide your personal data to
government, municipal institutions, banks, companies, corporate bodies and
individuals, where such obligation exists under a special legal provision,
where it is necessary for realization of your rights and legal interests as a
participant in the selection process, and when it is necessary to realize the
legitimate rights and interests of HPE. HPE can provide your personal
information to corporate bodies and individuals who are assigned to actions
and activities relating to the selection process and in respect of any future
contract of employment.

title: Linux Engineer with Finnish/Swedish or Spanish
description:
|  Established in 1986, Sutherland Global Services is a global BPO and
technology-enabled services company offering an integrated set of back-office
and customer facing front-office services that support the entire customer
lifecycle. It is one of the largest, independent BPO companies in the world
serving marquee clients in major industry verticals. Headquartered in
Rochester, New York, United States, Sutherland employs over 60,000
professionals and has nearly 60 global delivery centers.  
  
Opened in 2008 in Sofia, Sutherland Bulgaria is a multi-lingual customer
service hub and has since grown to more than 1300 employees in three different
sites, two in Sofia and one in Burgas which was opened in 2014. Our team of
professionals provides technical support and customer service in more than 16
European languages.  
  
Description of the Role  
  
We are looking for technical savvy to join one of our teams and start
providing technical support for one of the quick growing software as a service
companies.  
You will be responsible for troubleshooting problems in the field of software
functionality, application server setup, database management, data analysis,
operating system configuration, installation, migration and upgrades of an
e-learning product.  
  
Responsibilities:  
  
\- Manage resolution of complex application issues for a distinct set of
clients and also build high level of client trust  
\- Analyze customer problems to find the best technical solutions  
\- Takes part in implementation activities when needed  
\- Analyze trends associated with the assigned customer base and report
potential areas of risk or reward  
\- Able to prioritize tasks and to involve other teams when needed by
following the escalation pro-cedures  
\- Responsible also to document all cases and resolutions in order to create
good knowledge base  
  
Requirements:  
  
\- Very good command of English and Spanish/Finnish or Swedish language  
\- Technical, customer support, experience with enterprise software
applications  
\- Knowledge of Administration in at least one Server architecture (Windows,
Linux, Solaris)  
\- Knowledge of database administration principles in Oracle,
Sqlserver,PostgreSQL including trou-bleshooting, configuration and tuning  
\- Understanding of Internet application technologies including HTML, XML,
networking, firewalls, web server configurations and security  
\- Working knowledge of Java is preferred  
\- Attention to detail in handling and tracking technical issues  
-Team player with ability to prioritize   
  
Life at Sutherland:  
  
\- We offer competitive salary  
\- Excellent social benefits package including Health Insurance, Life
Insurance, Food vouchers, Compliment Cards, Transportation allowance  
\- Rewards and recognition programs  
\- Trainings following the leading global standards for highest quality of
Customer Service and Technical Support  
\- Structured working environment  
\- Career opportunities  
\- Great office location  
\- Team Building activities  
  
If you find this opportunity suitable for you and you want to develop your
career in a company which upholds highest industry standards, please send your
CV (in English).  
  
The information provided by you is personal and will be protected.  
Only the shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Senior Big Data Dev Ops Engineer
description:
|  VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure and business mobility.
Built on VMware's industry-leading virtualization technology, our solutions
deliver a new model of IT that is fluid, instant and more secure. Customers
can innovate faster by rapidly developing, automatically delivering and more
safely consuming any application.  
  
With 2015 revenues of $6.6 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers,
more than 75,000 partners, and 19,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the
world. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution,
passion, integrity, customers, and community. Do you dare to do the stuff
you've always dreamed about?  
  
VMware is looking for DevOps Engineers experienced with the continuous
delivery, operations and troubleshooting of a large scale distributed system.
We are looking for a person with great technical, interpersonal and
communication skills and passion for working with VMware products and state of
the art open source Big Data analytics solutions.  
  
Responsibilities:  
• Participate in the definition and improvement of the process to support a
robust and efficient continuous deployment of a Hadoop based analytics system  
• Participate in the automation of the continuous deployment process  
• Deploy and update various applications and platform components  
• Monitor and tune the availability, performance and resource allocation of
the system  
• Troubleshoot system issues reported by the monitoring system or customers  
• Efficiently interact with other R&D & IT organizations in order to
accomplish shared projects successfully  
  
Required:  
• Experience building and operating highly available and scalable
infrastructure solutions  
• Strong knowledge in Java or Python  
• Strong knowledge in Shell scripting  
• Hands on experience with Linux administration  
• Hands on experience with database technologies  
• Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or equivalent  
• Experience with Hadoop and related technologies (is a plus)  
  
Competencies:  
• Excelent verbal and written communication skills  
• Consistently take the appropriate actions to resolve problems of increasing
complexity  
• Seek active cooperation with others ensuring goal alignment with relevant
parties  
• Team player  
  
VMware offers:  
\- Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus
scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term
incentives  
\- Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced
by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of
world-wide IT professionals  
\- Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and
beverage program, sport activities, open communication  
\- Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, regular team buildings and
celebrations.  
  
As part of the VMware global standards for integrity you will be required to
go through a pre-employment screening process before you join.  
  
All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

title: Technical Support Consultant with Swedish or Dutch
description:
|  Established in 1986, Sutherland Global Services is a global BPO and
technology-enabled services company offering an integrated set of back-office
and customer facing front-office services that support the entire customer
lifecycle. It is one of the largest, independent BPO companies in the world
serving marquee clients in major industry verticals. Headquartered in
Rochester, New York, United States, Sutherland employs over 60,000
professionals and has nearly 60 global delivery centers.  
  
Opened in 2008 in Sofia, Sutherland Bulgaria is a multi-lingual customer
service hub and has since grown to more than 1300 employees in three different
sites, two in Sofia and one in Burgas which was opened in 2014. Our team of
professionals provides technical support and customer service in more than 16
European languages.  
  
We are currently looking for motivated technically oriented Swedish and Dutch
speakers to join our support team for a leading Anti-Virus software.  
  
Description of the Role  
  
Оur team of dedicated professionals provides both Customer and Technical
Support for home or home office users via phone, email and chat. Remote
sessions are also used.  
  
Responsibilities:  
  
\- Resolve the customer's issues with regards to Customer Service or Technical
support  
\- Respond to customer queries in a timely and professional manner  
\- Project a professional company image through phone, chat and email
interaction  
\- Provide customers with product and service information  
\- Prioritize tasks and to involve other teams when needed by following the
escalation procedures  
  
Requirements:  
  
\- Very good level of Dutch or Swedish  
\- Excellent communication and soft skills  
\- Strong listening/comprehension skills and good follow up skills  
\- Ability to multi task and to make quick decisions  
\- Ability to adapt quickly to changing business requirements.  
  
Life at Sutherland:  
  
\- We offer competitive salary  
\- Excellent social benefits package including Health Insurance, Life
Insurance, Food vouchers, Compliment Cards, Transportation allowance  
\- Rewards and recognition programs  
\- Trainings following the leading global standards for highest quality of
Customer Service and Technical Support  
\- Structured working environment  
\- Career opportunities  
\- Great office location  
\- Team Building activities  
  
If you find this opportunity suitable for you and you want to develop your
career in a company which upholds highest industry standards, please send your
CV (in English).  
  
The information provided by you is personal and will be protected.  
Only the shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Technical Support for Business Applications with English
description:
|  Established in 1986, Sutherland Global Services is a global BPO and
technology-enabled services company offering an integrated set of back-office
and customer facing front-office services that support the entire customer
lifecycle. It is one of the largest, independent BPO companies in the world
serving marquee clients in major industry verticals. Headquartered in
Rochester, New York, United States, Sutherland employs over 60,000
professionals and has nearly 60 global delivery centers.  
  
Opened in 2008 in Sofia, Sutherland Bulgaria is a multi-lingual customer
service hub and has since grown to more than 1300 employees in three different
sites, two in Sofia and one in Burgas which was opened in 2014. Our team of
professionals provides technical support and customer service in more than 16
European languages.  
  
Description of the Role  
  
The main focus of the role is providing technical support for small business
customers for cloud based applications.  
  
Responsibilities:  
  
\- Represent the company in a professional manner and achieve company goals  
\- Troubleshoot technical issues  
\- Guide customers through the process of online activation of subscription
and domain ownership verification  
\- Assist customers with billing queries  
\- Assist in configuring devices to email – mobile devices, tablets, PCs
(Android OS, Blackberry, iPhone, Windows Mobile etc)  
\- Provide support to add/remove/modify user permissions on emails, calendars,
shared documents etc.  
\- Provide information and guidance on Cloud storage and data maintenance  
  
Requirements:  
  
\- Command of English language at level C1 or above  
\- Excellent listening and communication skills, both written and verbal  
\- Comfortable approach when speaking to IT techs, end-users, decision-makers,
CEOs, etc  
\- Basic Understanding of DNS/CRM/Website hosting/Telephony  
\- Basic Understanding of web technologies (HTML, XML, HTTP protocols and
email management (IMAP, POP3, Exchange)  
\- Some experience in a service or support center and related understanding of
technical trouble-shooting is a plus  
\- Ability to work on flexible shifts (from 07:00 to 00:00), agreed in advance
with the team  
\- Ability to work on weekends  
  
Life at Sutherland:  
  
\- We offer competitive salary  
\- Excellent social benefits package including Health Insurance, Life
Insurance, Food vouchers, Compliment Cards, Transportation allowance  
\- Rewards and recognition programs  
\- Trainings following the leading global standards for highest quality of
Customer Service and Technical Support  
\- Structured working environment  
\- Career opportunities  
\- Great office location  
\- Team Building activities  
  
If you find this opportunity suitable for you and you want to develop your
career in a company which upholds highest industry standards, please send your
CV (in English).  
  
The information provided by you is personal and will be protected.  
Only the shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: SENIOR FULL STACK APPLICATION DEVELOPER
description:
|  Are you interested in cutting edge application development technologies?
Looking for an open, collaborative working environment with flexible work
hours and a diverse international culture? Want to challenge your coworkers to
a game of foosball on your lunch break, or perhaps join the office Photography
Club or Cooking Club? Infragistics offers all this and more - and we’re
hiring!  
  
Known as a worldwide leader in providing tools and solutions to accelerate
design, development and collaboration for any organization, Infragistics is
looking for a Senior Full Stack Application Developer to join our IS team
located in Sofia, Bulgaria. You will be responsible for technical design,
development, implementation and support of all tiers of our corporate websites
& portals, intranet web applications and services. As a senior member of
our team, you will be involved in planning projects, tasks and providing
guidance to team members.  
  
Responsibilities  
  
• Technical Design, Develop/Customize and Support  
\- Infragistics . com Site Content Management System Infrastructure, Business
layers and backend.  
\- All layers of our web portals: Forums, Blogs, ecommerce, Customer/Partner
Portals  
\- All layers of our CRM/ERP Internal Systems and intranet websites  
\- Integrations between third-party solutions and our websites/internal
systems  
• Collaborate with an international team of developers, UX/Visual designers,
business stake holders, leaders and managers to deliver these applications  
• Work with the team to arrive at the best-fit technology solutions  
• Ensure quality and use industry accepted best practices to implement designs  
• Write Wiki articles/document the technical design and implementation details  
• Provide guidance to other team members and own projects  
• Play a key role in defining standards for application development and source
management  
  
Qualifications  
  
Education/Technical Expertise  
• Bachelor degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or similar field
(equivalent professional experience)  
• 5+ years of Application development experience with Microsoft.NET and
related technologies with strong knowledge of web application development  
• Experience in ASP.NET MVC, C#, JavaScript/jQuery, CSS, HTML/XHTML/HTML5,
Entity Framework, SQL  
• Experience in building web services/APIs  
• Familiarity with SCRUM/Agile software development methodologies  
• Any experience with Umbraco CMS, AngularJS, CRM/ERP solutions like Microsoft
Dynamics CRM/GP is a plus  
  
Characteristics  
  
• Ability and experience in completing all phases of software development  
• Flexibility to handle the dynamic needs of the organization/management  
• Ability to understand how the business functions and implement appropriate
technical solutions  
• High attention to detail and providing extreme importance to quality of the
deliverables  
• Ability to prioritize, multi-task, organize work and set clear expectations  
• Ability to work as a team member and independently with minimal supervision  
  
We Offer  
  
• Open, friendly, collaborative working environment with cutting edge
technologies  
• Learn and improve top-notch, commercial software development practices
through on-the-job experience and ongoing professional development programs  
• Work with many other skilled developers all over the world  
• Company-provided external and internal trainings (English course, UX
training; Microsoft certification, ISTQB certification)  
• Additional health insurance  
• Company-provided food & beverages program  
• Flexible working time  
• Office massages  
• Food vouchers  
• Sport and relaxing activities - xBox, table tennis, foosball, as well as
yoga and morning gymnastics in the office  
• Chance to express yourself - share your hobby with the team by setting up a
club, or join one of the existing ones – we already have a Book Club, Cooking
Club, Photography Club  
  
If your profile fits our requirements and you would like to be part of a
passionate group of creative professionals delivering great software to a
large worldwide customer base, please send us your resume!
